text: {"answer":"H","reasoning":"i is incorrect: Dunant was motivated by the Battle of Solferino (1859), and he published “A Memory of Solferino” in 1862; it was not influenced by the American Civil War. ii is incorrect: an initiative violating the ECHR is not automatically invalid; the Federal Assembly invalidates only if it breaches mandatory international law (ius cogens), not ordinary human-rights treaty law. iii is incorrect: intent (Vorsatz) is defined in the General Part (Art. 12 SCC), not the Special Part. iv is incorrect: constitutional principles of administrative law (e.g., legality, proportionality, good faith, equality) also bind cantons when they act within their competences (Art. 35 FC and related provisions)."}
